paragraphs.text: “A book, too, can be a star, ‘explosive material, capable of stirring up fresh life endlessly,’ a living ﬁre to lighten the darkness, leading out into the expanding universe.” — Madeleine L’Engle
paragraphs.name: 291e

paragraphs.text: Translation: Pleasure reading connects you to humanity, expands your universe, AND keeps your brain sharp.
paragraphs.name: be11

paragraphs.text: I love all of that reading. Really. Sometimes I can’t believe that I’ve managed to build a life that involves so much reading. But there’s no space there for just pure pleasure reading.
paragraphs.name: bbf9

f410ad42214d.title: I’m taking my degree at the moment and had pretty much stopped reading for pleasure — this made me…

paragraphs.text: I’m taking my degree at the moment and had pretty much stopped reading for pleasure — this made me incredibly sad (and irritable and basically I was behaving like I did when I gave up cigarettes!) So I started always having a ‘for-fun’ book on the go, along with all my uni reading. Currently re-reading It by Stephen King, in anticipation of the new movie :D Loving it all over again!
paragraphs.name: 6d0c

95cb20ff68bd.title: DiogenesI read a great deal, more than most, I always have, and always will.

paragraphs.text: DiogenesI read a great deal, more than most, I always have, and always will. It is a good thing but not as great as many imagine it to be. I read because I cannot sleep, or at least sleep very little. So I read a great deal, from the great works of literature and philosophy to detective novels and faerie tales. I read a few books a week depending…
paragraphs.name: 42ac

content.subtitle: On the upside it means that I am well educated, knowledgeable, able to converse upon almost any topic in easy tones and hold discourse upon…

virtuals.subtitle: On the upside it means that I am well educated, knowledgeable, able to converse upon almost any topic in easy tones and hold discourse upon…

71c88d071a57.title: I love to read what other writers are up to.

paragraphs.text: I love to read what other writers are up to.
paragraphs.name: 237b

paragraphs.text: Can’t go a day without reading my favorite genre, which is sci-fi. I’m halfway through a re-reading of C.J. Cherryh’s 18 book (so far)Foreigner series. I read while I eat, steal time during the day when other commitments are done, and always at least 20 minutes before sleep. Sometimes I go short on sleep, but rarely on reading.

50276330a09e.title: I enjoy reading your articles all the time

paragraphs.text: I enjoy reading your articles all the time
paragraphs.name: 3d53

38099cf960b5.title: That John Green quote is the best!

paragraphs.text: That John Green quote is the best! I feel that way about the Harry Potter series, Speak by Laurie Halse Anderson, and most recently A Thousand Splendid Suns by Khaled Hosseini.
paragraphs.name: 9d80

98f5eefc864b.title: I’m also trying to slide some “for fun” reading between “productive” books.

paragraphs.text: I’m also trying to slide some “for fun” reading between “productive” books. I've just started James Corey’s The Expanse series. It’s a lot of books!
paragraphs.name: 701e

paragraphs.text: Thank you. But this makes me sad because I did not appreciate reading until just a few years ago. I realize now how much I missed but also how much even at my age there is to discover. Ok, maybe not to sad. Thanks again.
paragraphs.name: 1faa

f22acf2ae135.title: I hope that you spend at least some of your time reading things that you enjoy more than you enjoy…

paragraphs.text: I hope that you spend at least some of your time reading things that you enjoy more than you enjoy mine.
paragraphs.name: 86aa

889934a0e98d.title: I think I can summarize this article in a sentence. “Just go out there and read. No excuses.”

paragraphs.text: I think I can summarize this article in a sentence. “Just go out there and read. No excuses.”
paragraphs.name: 9d64

paragraphs.text: I love reading too!! And I can say that after I got an e-reader it was easier for me to squeeze in lots of reading time throughout my day. I profit from commute times, lunch break, waiting in line, waiting for an appointment… And with these moments I can enjoy both pleasurable books and “productive” ones.

b70fd8aacb7.title: My only question is: only 10 minutes?

paragraphs.text: My only question is: only 10 minutes? Can your really get pleasure from only ten minutes a day? I just realized that sounds unnecessarily naughty, and I suppose that if you do so much required reading 10 minutes can indeed be glorious, but I am used to reading for pleasure in long stretches of at the very least half and hour, most of the time one…
paragraphs.name: 4ea8

paragraphs.name: ef7a

4263447ab95d.title: When a writer uses “I” so many times, it might as well be your personal journal.

paragraphs.text: When a writer uses “I” so many times, it might as well be your personal journal. Objective writing is basic, and is abandoned when laziness begins. Are you speaking to readers or yourself? Introspective writing is easy, especially if you have a distorted view of your own importance.
paragraphs.name: 2ddc

8bd577edfcdd.title: I agree with your ideas ofpleasure reading.

paragraphs.text: I agree with your ideas ofpleasure reading. We are so busy in doing everything that we forget such simple enjoyments of picking a book and being lost in another world. Thanks for the article. ☺
Currently, I’m reading The Name of The Wind by Patrick Rothfuss.
paragraphs.name: 82f5

content.subtitle: Currently, I’m reading The Name of The Wind by Patrick Rothfuss.

virtuals.subtitle: Currently, I’m reading The Name of The Wind by Patrick Rothfuss.

5de0d33ae052.title: I read a lot, also listen a lot Audio books — while I am working out.

paragraphs.text: I read a lot, also listen a lot Audio books — while I am working out. I have been reading 6–7 books at a time, to capture the ideas all-together in my head.
paragraphs.name: 8c49

77ef3b13b304.title: Just finished my MFA last year and so glad to get back to pleasure reading.

paragraphs.text: Just finished my MFA last year and so glad to get back to pleasure reading. Although, as a writer, pleasure reading can often transform into research reading as your writing slowly intersects with what you’re consuming. Life is tricky that way.
paragraphs.name: eb0c

ca14e1f15379.title: You have, indeed, “managed to build a life that involves so much reading.”

paragraphs.text: You have, indeed, “managed to build a life that involves so much reading.” I read a lot, too. Being retired allows me to do that. But I read your weekly reading list and frankly, I am intimidated. Yet the point of this article is to do pleasure reading, too. Which you do…while you read “roughly three books a week, plus 30 poems, 30 short stories, and…
paragraphs.name: 10b9

11cd51e00233.title: Stephen King reads while working out on a treadmill. Just thought I’d toss that in here.

paragraphs.text: Stephen King reads while working out on a treadmill. Just thought I’d toss that in here.

4ea83ff70a96.title: Sometimes I go through months long droughts of not reading or, at least, not finishing reading…

paragraphs.text: Sometimes I go through months long droughts of not reading or, at least, not finishing reading anything and I find that I am generally much happier when I make a committed effort to reading regularly.
